instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H_CPU: What is PPBUS_G3H_CPU? PPBUS_G3H_CPU is the .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I have a short on ppbus.  if i remove <RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR> would it be safe to inject voltage since i removed <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_CPU</SIGNAL> from the equation?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Why don't compare the short resistance with the resistance to ground on all coils?
If none equal, then is safe to inject voltage.
However, start with 1V and set amp limit to max on lab PSU first.
